page.title: 03Mobile Library in Leverton
page.content: Once a fortnight we are visited by the {mobile library }which comes to the village on a Monday and stops outside the school at 2 o'clock for forty-five minutes.The librarian's name is Gordon White and he has worked on the libary van for 22 years.He says he enjoys his work very much.On Wednesdays the van is either cleaned and serviced or visits old peoples homes and the North sea camp.The libary van covers between 20 and 44 miles per day.It covers the rural areas around Boston.We asked if anything funny had happened to him and Mr White replied"This interview." Apart from that he could not think of anything on the spur of the moment .He also said that they had had an accident involving 3 other vehicles, but no-one was hurt.He thinks that the library van is a good idea and so do many others in the village.
